comment.text: This translation key is used to display an error message when a field is empty. It appears on the "Attribute Mapping" page as part of a form, specifically under fields marked as required (e.g., FirstName).

usage.context:
<div className="ldap_attribute-mapping">
 <FieldContainer
 style={FIELD_STYLE}
 isVertical
 labelVisible
 errorMessage={t("Common:EmptyFieldError")}
 hasError={errors.firstName}
 labelText={t("Common:FirstName")}
 isRequired
 >
 <LdapFieldComponent

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean translation '항목이 비어있습니다' literally translates to 'The item is empty'. While conveying the general idea of an empty field, it's a more formal and less direct phrasing than 'Empty field'. A more natural and concise translation would be '필수 항목을 입력해주세요' or '필수 입력 값 없음' depending on the context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider '필수 항목을 입력해주세요' or '필수 입력 값 없음'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While "ຊ່ອງວ່າງ" literally translates to "empty space" or "gap," it's not the most natural or commonly used translation for "Empty field" in a form/UI context.  It's too literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using "ບໍ່ເຕັມ" (bòh têm) which means 'not full' or 'incomplete', or "ບໍ່ມີຂໍ້ມູນ" (bòh mii khôm moon) which means 'no information'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'හිස් ක්‍ෂේත්‍රයකි' while literally meaning 'an empty field' doesn't quite convey the meaning of 'Empty field' in the context of a form or input field error. It sounds too formal and technical.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: A more natural and appropriate translation would be 'පොඩි දෙනුයි' (Podii Denui) which roughly translates to 'Please fill this in' or 'Required field' or ' හිස්සක් ගෙනත් පුරින්' (Hissak Genna Purin) which means 'Please fill in the empty space'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Slovak translation "Prázdne " is incomplete. It's missing the noun that "prázdne" (empty) is describing.  It should be something like "Prázdne pole" (Empty field).
